name: Citadines on Bourke Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was hesitant to book this room at first as I had read mixed review but after my stay i was glad i booked !! The room was as pictured, full of room and bright light. The kitchen was fully stocked with all things you could need to cook a meal however we chose to eat out. The bathroom had 2 doors, one leading into the living space and one leading into the bedroom, the shower was massive however we had issues with the way the water drained as it was going towards the room. We let the hotel know and they were prompt in responding. Great sleep on the bed. Great location, close to shops clubs and all things Melbourne. Overall my partner and I were satisfied with the stay and would recommend this hotel to all our friends who wished to stay in an apartment.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: So those of your trying to be healthy while traveling for work, will always seek out those serviced apartment options with a kitchen/kitchenette. Eating out every night for months on end doesn't bode too well for the waistline.
reviews.title: Great location, very handy kitchenette

reviews.text: Citadines is very well located right on Bourke St in the middle of the Melbourne CBD. Parking is easy with a self-park Secure Parking literally right next door for $20/night (or $30/night valet).
reviews.title: Excellent City Spot

reviews.text: I had booked a King Executive Room and was given a room on the 22nd floor with a nice view of the CBD. I specified a King bed, non-smoking during the booking.
reviews.title: Great stay, well designed room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately I was given one of those "twin singles put together to make a king bed" rooms, and the very pronounced MATTRESS RIB down the middle made sleeping extremely uncomfortable. This is completely unacceptable. The best feature of a hotel should be their bed, and they dropped the ball on this one.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in here for a few nights on our trip to Melbourne. It's in a good central location, very close to the centre of the city. Our room was a good size, had a sizeable kitchen, a desk/seating area, which a partition that could be extended to separate the bedroom from the lounge area and a nice size shower room with the sink outside (practical). The bed was a good size and comfortable, modern finish to the whole place, we were overlooking an alley which was fine as they were having construction and we asked to be somewhere away from it. There was also a stereo, which is a nice touch.
reviews.title: Great space, great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommend staying here, we didn't make as good a use of the kitchen as some, but I like having a kettle. Internet was not the cheapest and we ended up only paying for one 24 hr burst. You can access free wifi at the visitor information centre if you have a laptop/mobile device. We were in room 819.
reviews.title: This is our new place to stay in Melbourne

reviews.text: it's a relatively short walk to where you can get the tours (we did two, one to see the little penguins and one for the great ocean road.)
reviews.title: fantastic position

reviews.text: Good, clean, decent space, a nice base for our stay and would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great hotel with good service

reviews.text: I booked for one night through lastminute.com and the rate for an apartment room beat everything being marked for studio-style rooms in the top hotels in melbourne.
reviews.title: Location location

reviews.text: I stayed here while on a work trip to melbourne for a week. The room and accomodation were modern and simple and were not impacted by street noise. The only problem I had while I stayed was that the room was not serviced properly while I was there. The bin was not emptied for 4 days and the dishwasher detergent, washing up detergent and toliet paper was not replaced. Apart from that I would definately stay here again next time I am in Melbourne for an extended stay.
reviews.title: Pretty good place to stay for an extended period of time

reviews.text: This hotel is new and really popular. I was unlucky to arrive the hotel at 8 am after the overnight fligt. And the hotel was so full that i need to wait until 2.30pm to have my room ready.
reviews.title: Modern comfortable stay

reviews.text: I stayed there for 2 weeks on a business trip in a studio apartment. Room was spacious with all the amenities there, big ceiling to floor window, small kitchen, with fridge, hifi with iPod dock, a HDTV without HDTV channel.
reviews.title: I'll definitely be back

reviews.text: The room I stayed more like a accessible room, which don't have a proper shower place, using a shower curtain to separate the area.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is excellent, close to all the stores, David jones, myers, china town. Food outlets are plenty, as well as supermarket, can go to china town or Woolworth and big w at QV.
reviews.title: Modern hotel & comfy bed!

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed 3 nights at this hotel, for a "mother/daughter long weekend".
reviews.title: Would definitely return to this hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found everything very nice and clean, and well equipped in every way.
reviews.title: Clean, Comfortable & would definitely recommend

reviews.text: Just a very minor hiccup - the dishwasher had to be repaired (no problem there),
reviews.title: great stay and we will be back

reviews.text: and had to request face cloths a couple of times. Otherwise staff were very friendly and helpful in every way.
reviews.title: Fantastic location!

reviews.text: The beds were clean and comfortable (especially the pillows), nice crisp sheets and a feather duvet. All nice and white. The room was fully serviced each day.
reviews.title: As promised .. New, funky, clean, good location

reviews.text: Comfy, clean, convenient to shopping, & sights. Nice to have a little kitchen in the room-sink,two burner stove, small fridge, microwave. Hairdryer, iron and board. Flat screen TV and stereo with Ipod dock, and a sofa desk and small coffee table all efficiently arranged in one room. I thought it was a good value. Staff was helpful. Check in was a little slow.
reviews.title: great find

reviews.text: I spent two weeks in Melbourne attending the IUGG General Assembly. The hotel was a perfect choice as I was travelling with family. The bedroom I stayed was not that large but was very comfortable and the kitchen proved to be essential (for preparing breakfast and meals). Front desk is great. Service is good (with the usual annoyances of having to ask for extra soap at times). Worth the price paid. Excellent location. One comment on Melbourne, though. A very expensive city. Even the Scandinavians attending the Conference were complaining.
reviews.title: Comfortable

reviews.text: In Melbourne for business but also wanted to be near Her Majesty's theatre to take in a show at the conclusion of meetings. These new apartments are wonderfully central to shopping, theatres, cafes and restaurants. Check in staff helpfull and efficient, our quiet, one bedroom apartment was spotless and very comfortable. I left my mobile charger in the room and one phone call to their helpful staff had my charger in the post back to me in no time . We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great discovery

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights during the first week of July for my birthday. We wanted to stay somewhere that was very central, nicely decorated and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Finally! A Fantastic hotel that delivers what it promises and more!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Citadines offered all this and more! when we arrived the reception staff were very helpful and friendly. We stayed in the studio deluxe room which was very clean and beautifully decorated. The flat screen was conveniently located to watch from bed and the kitchenette was fully equipped, enough for my partner to cook me breaky in bed!
reviews.title: Grat value, well serviced, top accomodation.

reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at the Citadines on Bourke on Saturday and Sunday night, we had a single bed each which was very comfortable, the quilt was fantastic. I cannot say enough about how clean the room was. The location is excellent and staff are courteous and efficient. There was no outside noise, however we could hear what appeared to be a hens party going on in the room next door, but they went out and all was quiet. The room amenities were excellent. I will highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for accommodation in Melbourne. My only critisism would be the lack of an informtion folder in the room, but in fairness there are information computers located in the foyer.
reviews.title: Fantastic accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was great, all we caould have expected. Its in a great location with so many places to shop, eat and drink nearby. Unfortunately I left a jacked in the room and called that afternoon to let them know. I ended up calling 3 times befre i was told it wasn't in the room and there wan not much they could do about it.! I realise it was my fault for leaving the jacket but a little more investigation and follow up would have been appreciated as the jacket was rather expensive.
reviews.title: Disappointing ending

reviews.text: Due to this i would be hesitant to return.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there in august for 3 nights and were very happy with the hotel, staff and location. We would definently stay there again. The rooms are clean and spacious and fully contained and serviced daily, if I had a gripe it would be I didn't have a shower cap!! The hotel is close enough to everything yet far away enough that is not noisy! Great hotel
reviews.title: Excellent and clean

reviews.text: The entry to the hotel is large and the reception is basic, but nice.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the comforts

reviews.text: Three of us went to Melbourne for the weekend to celebrate my friends birthday. Couldn't really fault this apartment. We had a two bedroom, two bathroom apartment on the 23rd floor with magnificent views. Perfect location right in the centre of Melbourne. The staff were very friendly and eager to please. Only small complaint was that we were charged $15 per day for WiFi access and also a $20 per hour late checkout fee. I didn't think these charges were really necessary. Apart from that would highly recommend these apartments.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Rooms new, large, kitchenette, good value. Lovely pool, great central city location.
reviews.title: New Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked 2 rooms for parents and children, rooms were about 10 rooms apart despite emailing before arrival.
reviews.title: Contemporary, Sleek, and New

reviews.text: Downside was a nearby nightclub, went all night, making it impossible to sleep. Was given a late checkout, but room/lift card stops at 11am, so 2 family members were stuck in the lift in swimwear. Only solution is to go to reception to have card time extended.
reviews.title: Great serviced apartment/hotel in the heart of the city

reviews.text: Have stayed there on 3 occassions, good accommodation if the price is right and you are not bothered about getting a good nights sleep.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for business or family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I grew up in Melbourne but this was my Fiance's first trip there and I wanted somewhere central to base ourselves while exploring and visiting family and friends. Citadines is very centrally located, right on Bourke st just up from Russell St. The rooms were lovely and spacious with a little kitchenette which is handy if you're staying for a little longer and want to save yourself a little money eating out, or alternatively have been to the Vic market and seen something amazing that you just had to try. We didnt have a car so I cant comment on parking at all but for those who arent driving, the tram is right out the front of the hotel, there are more trams on Swanston and Collins sts which are near by and if you needed to get on the trains Melbourne Central, Parliament and Flinders st are all not too far away. We'd definately be happy to stay here again.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring Melbourne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you factor in the cost and location, this is a great little place to stay. I have no major issues with the hotel, but it left me underwhelmed.
reviews.title: Average to Good in many catergories but a master of none

reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, it ticks plenty boxes, good price, good central location, moderate service, clean, and it has all the basic amenities you'd expect from a 4 star hotel. Simply put, it's good in many categories, but a master of none.
reviews.title: NEW, CLEAN, CENTRAL, CONVENIENT! SIMPLE GREAT!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I were in need of finding affordable accommodation in a hurry for a weekend escape to Melbourne, I would gladly stay at Citadines once again. That being said, if I had the time to look through deals for other preferable hotels in Melbourne, that would be my preference.
reviews.title: Great location, new and clean, everything you could want

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed in one of the studio rooms, no problems there. It was clean upon arrival, plenty of space, and I found the quirky little kitchen area rather cheeky but convenient. My biggest pet peeves when staying in a hotel room is when the website states that it is a queen or a double, but it ends up being 2 singles put together. It just absolutely agitates me to no end! If it's 2 singles, state it as such - quite simple really.
reviews.title: Brand new hotel with flaws

description: Citadines on Bourke Melbourne, in the heart of the city's CBD, offers access to major business and financial offices as well as many world-renowned restaurants, entertainment areas, shopping districts and theatres. Designed for international and domestic travellers on business or leisure, each vibrant apartment has modern amenities along with access to the business corner and fitness corner for efficiency and convenience. Explore Melbourne and relax in the privacy and comfort of your Apart'hotel.
